5. Please protect yourself and loved ones from misinformation. Vaccines, boosters, masking and social distancing remain the primary ways to protect yourself from a severe and deadly case of COVID-19. Please take care among those who are most vulnerable & take care of yourself!

4. Thank our health care workers! Right now our health care systems are overwhelmed with patients. Please do your part and get vaccinated. One of the most heartbreaking stories I heard recently is of a doctor recounting how many patients ask for the vaccine after it’s too late.😢

3. If you can, stay at home as much as possible—Last week I had to travel to DC for votes, and though I was extremely careful, Omicron is highly transmissible and exposure can happen in countless ways. Please wear a N95/KN95 mask and take extra special care when you are out.

2. Get tested—If you have symptoms, please get tested and quarantine. I took an at-home test, which helped me get the right kind of medical care right away. You can order 4 free tests here: http://covidtests.gov
